props.propertyComment: The bottom bar appears in mobile resolution only. Put here some bottom navigation in mobile view.
The bottom toolbar content items, better to use a single item inside. It appears in the mobile resolutions.
The navigation key of the currently selected navigation item

If true then the component's instance will not be allowed to use in flows,
 and you will not see the instance name in the pages instances list
The list of navigation items. Use not more than 4-5 items due to look good in the mobile resolution.
If true, the button will be disabled.
The navigation icon.
The navigation item label. Shown only when showLabels is true.
The navigation key
If true, the button will be disabled.
The navigation icon.
The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.

If true then the component's instance will not be allowed to use in flows,
 and you will not see the instance name in the pages instances list
The fontSize applied to the icon. Defaults to 24px, but can be configure to inherit font size.
Icon drawing style.
The navigation item label. Shown only when showLabels is true.

Triggered when the user click on the navigation item. Pass the navigation key value.
The currently selected navigation key value.

If true, all navigation items will show their labels.
 By default, only the selected navigation item will show its label.
Shadow depth. It accepts values between 0 and 24 inclusive.

If true then the component's instance will not be allowed to use in flows,
 and you will not see the instance name in the pages instances list
Drawer
Put the components inside the drawer.

If true then the component's instance will not be allowed to use in flows,

An array of the data objects references.
 Each data object item in the itemsData references to the item in the itemsMetaData by the "type" value.

 Read more in the component's Readme.

The array of the data objects.

 Read about the structure of the data object in the component's Readme.

Add JSON description of the nested list items.
 The structure of each child should be equal to the parent list item.

Any arbitrary data you want to pass through the list item when the user clicks on the item.
 This data will appear in the onItemClick output object.
It is used for creating an URL link in the list item instead of a button.
The list item is. It is a required field and should be unique.
Extra properties
If true, compact vertical padding designed for keyboard and mouse input will be used.
If true, the left and right padding is removed.
If true, the list item will be disabled.
If true, a 1px light border is added to the bottom of the list item.
If true, the list item will be selected

If true, the text will have a bottom margin.

If true, the text will not wrap, but instead will truncate with a text overflow ellipsis.
 Note that text overflow can only happen with block or inline-block level elements
 (the element needs to have a width in order to overflow).

A list of the styles groups applied to different screen sizes accordingly.
 Reload the entire page to see the changes.
 The changes are not applied immediately due to the JSS nature of the Box component.

A screen size breakpoint id.
 Find the real size value in the application settings in LivePreview.

A groups of styles that are applied for the selected breakpoint.
 Reload the entire page to see the changes.
 The changes are not applied immediately due to the JSS nature of the Box component.
Set style to element's border

The border-width CSS property sets the width of an element's border.
 When the value is specified, it applies the same width to all four sides.
The border-bottom-width CSS property sets the width of the bottom border of an element.
The border-color CSS property sets the color of an element's border.
A value from the collection of colors, i.e. hues
A value from the collection of colors shades
The border-left-width CSS property sets the width of the left border of an element.

The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge.
 You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.
 Use a string value of the border radius to set units: 10% 30% 50% 70%
The border-right-width CSS property sets the width of the right border of an element.
The border-top-width CSS property sets the width of the top border of an element
A value from the collection of colors, i.e. hues
A value from the collection of colors shades
A value from the collection of colors, i.e. hues
A value from the collection of colors shades
Easily make an element as wide or as tall (relative to its parent) with the width and height utilities.

The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.
 By default, the property defines the height of the content area.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The max-height CSS property sets the maximum height of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The max-width CSS property sets the maximum width of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified by max-width.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The min-height CSS property sets the minimum height of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The min-width CSS property sets the minimum width of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The width CSS property sets an element's width. By default, it sets the width of the content area.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%
A range of shorthand responsive margin and padding utility classes to modify an element’s appearance.

A group of the margin properties
 Depending on the input and the theme configuration, the following transformation is applied:
 (1) number - the property is multiplied by the theme spacing value,
 (2) number - the property is used as the array index in theme spacing array,
 (3) string - the property is passed as raw CSS value
The property sets the margin area.
The property sets the margin area on the bottom of an element.
The property sets the margin area on the left side of an element.
The property sets the margin area on the right side of an element.
The property sets the margin area on the top of an element.
The property sets the margin area on the left and right sides of an element.
The property sets the margin area on the top and bottom sides of an element.

A group of the padding properties.
 Depending on the input and the theme configuration, the following transformation is applied:
 (1) number - the property is multiplied by the theme spacing value,
 (2) number - the property is used as the array index in theme spacing array,
 (3) string - the property is passed as raw CSS value
The property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the bottom of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the left side of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the right side of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the top of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the left and right sides of an element.
The property sets the padding area on the top and bottom sides of an element.

A screen size breakpoint id.
 Find the real size value in the application settings in LivePreview.

A groups of styles that are applied for the selected breakpoint.
 Reload the entire page to see the changes.
 The changes are not applied immediately due to the JSS nature of the Box component.

Common flex props.
Defines the align-content style property. It's applied for all screen sizes.
Defines the align-items style property. It's applied for all screen sizes.
Defines the flex-direction style property. It is applied for all screen sizes.
Defines the justify-content style property. It is applied for all screen sizes.
Defines the flex-wrap style property. It's applied for all screen sizes.
Common container properties, it's applied only to the container component.
Defines the space between the type item component.
Set disableMaxWidth to true to disable maxWidth.

If true then the component's instance will not be allowed to use in flows,
 and you will not see the instance name in the pages instances list

Set the max-width to match the min-width of the current breakpoint.
 This is useful if you'd prefer to design for a fixed set of sizes instead of trying to
 accommodate a fully fluid viewport.
 It's fluid by default.

Determine the max-width of the container.
 The container width grows with the size of the screen.
 Set disableMaxWidth to true to disable maxWidth.
CSS size values

The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.
 By default, the property defines the height of the content area.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The max-height CSS property sets the maximum height of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The max-width CSS property sets the maximum width of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified by max-width.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The min-height CSS property sets the minimum height of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The min-width CSS property sets the minimum width of an element.
 It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%

The width CSS property sets an element's width. By default, it sets the width of the content area.
 Use a string value to specify units: 50%
